intro: Crotalaria roxburghiana, commonly known as the Indian glory flower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to regions of Asia, including India, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow and orange flowers. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has also been used in traditional medicine. Crotalaria roxburghiana is known for its ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
